summary: 694- You are all different in the Force
title: 694- You are all different in the Force
description:
Charlie begins our discussion of Star Wars The Clone Wars with a focus on Yoda’s comment to the clones that they are all different and distinct in the Force.

Become a supporter of this podcast: https://anchor.fm/projectshadow/support https://flipboard.com/ via Project: Shadow

summary: Tweens
title: Tweens
body:
read it on the AO3 at http://bit.ly/2RqClrk

by Haunt_Haunt_Haunt

What happens in a dark forest on a spooky night in September? Well, if you live in Monstropolis, it’s tweens.

Words: 681, Chapters: 1/1, Language: English

  • Fandoms: Monster Prom (Visual Novel), Star Wars: Rebels
  • Rating: Teen And Up Audiences
  • Warnings: No Archive Warnings Apply
  • Categories: Gen
  • Characters: Original Male Character(s), Ezra Bridger
  • Additional Tags: Just an Intro to My Next Big Thing, Tweens, Boy Bands, Power Level over 9000, Witches, Soul Selling, incubus

summary: First look at new Star Wars: Return of the Jedi Funko Pops!
body:
It’s winter so that means

indoor activities like reading. Catch up on my most recent articles from Fansided’s Dork Side of the Force here:

First look at new Star Wars: Return of the Jedi Funko Pops!

Star Wars Style: The Force Awakens Finn jacket

Details emerge on Galaxy’s Edge’s Star Wars: Rise of the Resistance ride

Fans have chosen: Puppet Yoda

Star Wars: Galaxy’s Edge: Try the ale before the Disney park opens

Thank you for reading and may the Force be with you, always 🌌

blog.name: totallycorrectstarwarsquotes
blog.title: Totallycorrectstarwarsquotes
blog.description: | These are 110% real | I’m Star Wars Trash | Lots of Kylux | Talk to me about our disaster space gays | Asks and submissions are always open |

summary:
Hux, sighing: in light of what you did for me... you can hug me for four to five seconds.
Kylo, immediately pulling him into a...
body:
Hux, sighing: in light of what you did for me… you can hug me for four to five seconds.

Kylo, immediately pulling him into a huge bear hug: Fourty-five seconds?!

Hux, already struggling: NO! FOUR TO FIVE SECONDS!

reblog.comment:

Hux, already struggling: NO! FOUR TO FIVE SECONDS!

blog.name: mandowords
blog.title: Miit'alor
blog.description: I am a descriptivist linguist for the Mando'a language. I show what it can do, not what it MUST do. This is a place for discussion about Mando'a, and Mandalorian society and culture. Feel free to use the head cannons from this blog (or reblogged from others) in your RP or writing. All words and descriptions are taken from the mandoa.org Mandalorian Dictionary. Want to support this blog? Buy me a Kofi? OR buy some Mando'a themed items? Visit our Discord? Blog icon by Rina

summary: Fates Entwined
title: Fates Entwined
body:
Rating: T

Characters: Anakin Skywalker, Padme Amidala, Shmi Skywalker

Summary: Shmi had never imagined herself as a mother. Jedi were not permitted to have families. But the day she found out she was pregnant, she was in such shock and disbelief. But, she wanted to raise her child. She felt a love for him that she’d never felt before— an attachment that was undoubtably forbidden by the teachings of the Jedi. And so, her only option was clear: leave.

Status: In-Progress

Read it on Fanfiction.net

summary: Okay so normally I don’t talk too much about my AUs here cause none of you ever care in the slightest, but I did a funny thing....
body:
Okay so normally I don’t talk too much about my AUs here cause none of you ever care in the slightest, but I did a funny thing. So I’m making an AU where Qui-Gon never went to the temple, but then Dooku still ended up finding him when he’s a scrawny little 15 yo homeless kid, immediately adopts him. He’s not a very present father because obviously he’s off being a Jedi himself, but since Qui-Gon isn’t a Jedi, he feels more of a need to protect him and none the less, is a loving father. If not constantly there.

So that’s backstory, whatever. I just have a fondness for Dooku being an actual good parent lol, but the real story is set much later on. Qui-Gon is older, Dooku is Hella Old, and Qui-Gon is married on Naboo now to a very nice man, with a few kids of their own. How nice.

Dooku is visiting the temple one day when Yoda tells him Initiate Kenobi needs to be adopted out and ‘happen to know, do you, of a family for this little one’ because Yoda is 1000000% sure that if the council gets their way and sends him off to one of the corps, this kid is gonna self destruct and fall into a depression so deep he’ll never climb out and the kid’s fucking 13 years old and Yoda is like ‘omfg fuck that noise that’s a baby why are y’all so uncaring of how BROKEN he is’ (he broken for a reason okay I’m not gonna say more than that it’s a Bad Situation for a kid to be in) and Dooku is all ‘well, I may know one’

Shows up on Naboo two weeks later like ‘surprise! I got you a present while I was away!’ *proceeds to shove a small child on his only son* Qui-Gon: …hmm… I like this gift. I’m keeping it.

But so the funny part about this story? The Sith are a non-issue. Completely a non-issue and not at all a threat. (Listen, sometimes you gotta do it okay. An AU is an AU and I need variety.)

Anyways, all that was 100% useless backstory lol never gonna get that part of your life back, but so anyways, for those of you still around, for your consideration: Palpatine still exists, but he’s an alumni of the Royal Academy on Naboo, and actually distantly related to Qui-Gon’s husband (Okay I chose Naboo for a reason) but instead of being a creepy old asshole, he’s sorta senile, and def 100% force sensitive, and Obi-Wan is always complaining whenever he has to be around him that ‘he tells me the same ten stories over and over again because he forgets, and since his hip is bad he wont stop misusing the force to get things for him- Dad stop laughing, it’s not funny, he misuses the force, it’s really not okay, Dad stop!’ While Qui-Gon just fucking laughs himself sick because Obi-Wan is such a stuffy little thing and it’s adorable

Anyways, consider: senile Palpatine who’s constantly telling people ‘I could have been a Jedi! But my parents loved me too much, wouldn’t let me leave! Did I ever tell you about the time I considered being a senator? It was a fun time. I ended up in a dumpster! Twice!’ And wont stop misusing the force

Shows up on Naboo two weeks later like ‘surprise! I got you a present while I was away!’ *proceeds to shove a small child on his only son* Qui-Gon: …hmm… I like this gift. I’m keeping it.

But so the funny part about this story? The Sith are a non-issue. Completely a non-issue and not at all a threat. (Listen, sometimes you gotta do it okay. An AU is an AU and I need variety.)

Anyways, all that was 100% useless backstory lol never gonna get that part of your life back, but so anyways, for those of you still around, for your consideration: Palpatine still exists, but he’s an alumni of the Royal Academy on Naboo, and actually distantly related to Qui-Gon’s husband (Okay I chose Naboo for a reason) but instead of being a creepy old asshole, he’s sorta senile, and def 100% force sensitive, and Obi-Wan is always complaining whenever he has to be around him that ‘he tells me the same ten stories over and over again because he forgets, and since his hip is bad he wont stop misusing the force to get things for him- Dad stop laughing, it’s not funny, he misuses the force, it’s really not okay, Dad stop!’ While Qui-Gon just fucking laughs himself sick because Obi-Wan is such a stuffy little thing and it’s adorable

Anyways, consider: senile Palpatine who’s constantly telling people ‘I could have been a Jedi! But my parents loved me too much, wouldn’t let me leave! Did I ever tell you about the time I considered being a senator? It was a fun time. I ended up in a dumpster! Twice!’ And wont stop misusing the force

summary:
Star Wars Episode IX-optagelserne nærmer sig afslutningen 
Optagelserne til den afsluttende Star Wars-film nærmer sig...
caption:
Star Wars Episode IX-optagelserne nærmer sig afslutningen
Optagelserne til den afsluttende Star Wars-film nærmer sig angiveligt afslutningen. Men modsat traditionen kommer der ingen trailer under Super Bowl. Indlægget Star Wars Episode IX-optagelserne nærmer sig afslutningen blev først udgivet på iNPUT. . .

blog.name: swpromptsandasks
blog.title: StarWars prompts and asks
blog.description: Send me your best (weird, nsfw and cute) prompts and asks for Star wars and if they contain Obi-Wan then hurray for me. Lets see what we can drum up. (I don't write for the last trilogy, apologies)

summary: In Father Sheev what were they asking Obi about? Jedi are going to be buried when it become public that they killed the...
question: In Father Sheev what were they asking Obi about? Jedi are going to be buried when it become public that they killed the bodyguards/healers of a pregnant man and attacked him causing a premature labor!
answer:
Panting sharply, Obi-Wan allowed the medic to get him into position with the covering activated around his lower half, groaning in pain at the contraction that went through him.

And yet through the pain he couldn’t help a silver of smugness.

Windu had come looking so certain of his cause with four other council members, clearly a strong arm delegation to intimidate Obi-Wan into agreeing to come to the temple for questioning. As if he was some kind of common criminal.

Of course things had been peaceful to start.

But the more the Jedi insisted, the more Obi-Wan realized… they knew.

They must have known about Anakin and now they wanted answers, a confession.

And when his bodyguards intervened and stepped between them… well…

Things went from bad to worse.

Obi-Wan clearly had no other choice left, regardless of the child he carried, regardless of how his father might not be ready just yet, regardless how Anakin was not there to protect him.

He had summoned his saber to his hand and flashed golden eyes at them.

That had… kind of been all he needed to do really as all four Jedi to draw their own sabers though Obi-Wan had needed to taunt them about the fall of their precious temple before they finally attacked.

He wasn’t even sure they knew he was pregnant until Windu got his saber away from him and Obi-Wan fell to the ground, his water breaking.

The look on his face…

Even now it got a pained laugh out of Obi-Wan.

The situation would look so bad for the Jedi.

Attacking a pregnant former and beloved Senator of Naboo who had served in the Republic as a governor under his father until ‘illness’ prevented him from continuing, prompting a premature labor.

Yelping in pain when a medic touched under the coverings, Obi-Wan jerked his legs in the stirrups.

There was a curse from down below. “He’s not dilating fast enough, the baby is already pushing,” The togruta called before cursing louder. “And the first baby is in breech position! Get me U-T50!” She called.

Panting sharply, Obi-Wan’s eyes widened. “B-Breech? F-First baby?” He called in a panic.

A nurse quickly moved to the front, wiping his forehead. “You need to try and breath serah Palpatine, just keep breathing, we’ll do our part.” He assured the redhead and Obi-Wan whimpered, grasping onto the nurse hand for he had blond hair just like Anakin and Force Obi-Wan wanted his husband.

He wanted ANAKIN!

()()()

Glancing uncertainly after the troopers who were carrying away an unconscious twi’lek of about eleven, Anakin rubbed the back of his neck.

He wasn’t certain what was going on but apparently the troopers had specific orders for the children and so far he had been told that it was ‘none-lethal’ and apparently on the request of the younger Palpatine.

From Obi-Wan.

Obi-Wan who knew mercy and could potentially change his father, the Sith’s mind?

Sith…

Like Anakin now was.

Swallowing heavily, Anakin looked out over the room that had once housed Jedi of all kinds, trying not to look to hard at the bodies of adults littering the floor. ‘It… it had to be done. They… Windu attacked Obi-Wan!’ He assured himself or tried to.

It was hard to argue with the sight of bodies laying with glassy eyes on the ground and sabers near their fingers.

ANAKIN!

Jerking to, Anakin turned, eyes wide before barking at Appo to take lead since the Jedi were taken care of for now.

Obi-Wan was yelling for him, his voice coated in pain and panic.

The baby and his Obi-Wan, they needed him.

blog.name: swpromptsandasks
blog.title: StarWars prompts and asks
blog.description: Send me your best (weird, nsfw and cute) prompts and asks for Star wars and if they contain Obi-Wan then hurray for me. Lets see what we can drum up. (I don't write for the last trilogy, apologies)

summary: O.O Moddy?  DocileDoll?  Would the Rebellion reeeaaally let ObiWan settle in one place?  The Negotiator, with all that knowledge...
question: O.O Moddy?  DocileDoll?  Would the Rebellion reeeaaally let ObiWan settle in one place?  The Negotiator, with all that knowledge of people and events from before the Empire, MUST be an important and VALUABLE playing piece on the board.  And for the last known Jedi to stay in one place??  Vader wouldn't have to hunt too hard, hmmmm?  So.  Protective custody maybe?  How WOULD Obi and the clones react??
answer:
Jerking awake when the door snaps open abruptly, Obi-Wan reaches for the saber that no longer hangs on his belt as the light floods the room and momentarily blinds him. For a moment he thinks Vader has found him regardless of them drifting in space, for a moment he wonders if he’s going back to his docile state.

And then he remembers he’s not wearing a belt at this moment, he’s wearing thin shift clothes and his eyes become accustom to the light, showing him only Rex striding quickly into the room.

The former GAR captain is dressed in his old armor and is armed to the teeth with blasters and viroblade as he snatches Obi-Wan’s boots and socks out of the little locker in the room.

“Rex’s wha-” Obi-Wan sits up, throwing his feet over the end of the bed as he tries to question the man only for Rex to kneel down and quickly slide his socks onto Obi-Wan’s feet.

“We don’t have long, we have to go.” Rex said gruffly, snapping on Obi-Wan’s boots with a rougher grip than normal since Obi-Wan arrived at the Rebellion thanks to Rex rescue.

Blinking, Obi-Wan stood obediently, confused as he took note of the pack hanging on Rex back as the man threw Obi-Wan’s robe around him, fastened it and then took a hold of his hand and pulled him out into the bright, gray hallway.

He’s alarmed to see Waxer and Boil kitted out in their old armors right outside his room and Obi-Wan opened his mouth only to stare at a togruta that had been helping him hours earlier, laying out on the floor in a still manner with a clearly knocked over tray beside her.

“Knockout gas,” Boil answered quickly, seeing the former generals face. “She’s alive.”

Even more confused, Obi-Wan only followed, trusting these men with his life and sanity as he followed through the corridors and elevators to the hanger of the ship.

The entire way was paved with people knocked out where ever they had been when the gas came and droids standing still, jerking or twitching as they tried to boot themselves up as Rex hurried them past with a determined look on his face.

Actually, all three former troopers were oozing of a mix of protective rage, determination and urgency.

‘What happened while I was asleep?’ Obi-Wan wondered in surprise as the elevator doors opened with a soft ping, eyes widening up when he noticed the shuttle ready to take off in the hanger, troopers milling around it.

He recognized some of them.

Others not.

But all of them were armed to the teeth and in armor.

When they saw the group making their way towards them, they all finished up their tasks and made their way into the shuttle where Rex pulled Obi-Wan up the ramp along. “We’re all here! Raise the ramp and go!” Rex called sternly before turning to Obi-Wan. “…Okay… now you can ask.” He said quietly.

“…What the kark is going on Rex?” Obi-Wan whispered, eyes wide, his free hand shaking.

Things had not made sense since Anakin became Vader and right now he wondered…

“The Alliance leadership are desperate,” Rex started slowly. “They… were going to force you to help, to guilt you into it… as your duty to the fallen Republic as a Jedi. We couldn’t allow that,” Rex explained quietly before glancing around the cargo hold of the shuttle they were taking out. “Vader will be after you, they know it, they were going to use you as bait and…” The captain swallowed.

Waxer spoke up. “We got our hands on an old refurbished CR-12 Corvette,” He smiled happily only for the smile to fade. “They’re not using us and they’re not using you. We’ve bleed enough for people who never cared. And if we find vode and Jedi along the way, we’ll take them with us as we take potshots at the Empire but we’re not being used by others, not anymore.” He added softly.

Blinking, Obi-Wan looked at the serious faces around him before letting out a quiet nose and stepping into Rex space, wrapping his arms around the mans neck to hide his face in a pauldron. “…Thank you.” He breathed out, feeling arms slowly come up around him in return.

“An par solus, bal solus par an Obi-Wan.” Rex murmured.

‘All for one, one for all… fitting.’ Obi-Wan tightened his hold.

And if we find vode and Jedi along the way, we’ll take them with us as we take potshots at the Empire but we’re not being used by others, not anymore.” He added softly.

Blinking, Obi-Wan looked at the serious faces around him before letting out a quiet nose and stepping into Rex space, wrapping his arms around the mans neck to hide his face in a pauldron. “…Thank you.” He breathed out, feeling arms slowly come up around him in return.

“An par solus, bal solus par an Obi-Wan.” Rex murmured.

‘All for one, one for all… fitting.’ Obi-Wan tightened his hold.
trail.content:
Jerking awake when the door snaps open abruptly, Obi-Wan reaches for the saber that no longer hangs on his belt as the light floods the room and momentarily blinds him. For a moment he thinks Vader has found him regardless of them drifting in space, for a moment he wonders if he’s going back to his docile state.

And then he remembers he’s not wearing a belt at this moment, he’s wearing thin shift clothes and his eyes become accustom to the light, showing him only Rex striding quickly into the room.

The former GAR captain is dressed in his old armor and is armed to the teeth with blasters and viroblade as he snatches Obi-Wan’s boots and socks out of the little locker in the room.

“Rex’s wha-” Obi-Wan sits up, throwing his feet over the end of the bed as he tries to question the man only for Rex to kneel down and quickly slide his socks onto Obi-Wan’s feet.

“We don’t have long, we have to go.” Rex said gruffly, snapping on Obi-Wan’s boots with a rougher grip than normal since Obi-Wan arrived at the Rebellion thanks to Rex rescue.

Blinking, Obi-Wan stood obediently, confused as he took note of the pack hanging on Rex back as the man threw Obi-Wan’s robe around him, fastened it and then took a hold of his hand and pulled him out into the bright, gray hallway.

He’s alarmed to see Waxer and Boil kitted out in their old armors right outside his room and Obi-Wan opened his mouth only to stare at a togruta that had been helping him hours earlier, laying out on the floor in a still manner with a clearly knocked over tray beside her.

“Knockout gas,” Boil answered quickly, seeing the former generals face. “She’s alive.”

Even more confused, Obi-Wan only followed, trusting these men with his life and sanity as he followed through the corridors and elevators to the hanger of the ship.

The entire way was paved with people knocked out where ever they had been when the gas came and droids standing still, jerking or twitching as they tried to boot themselves up as Rex hurried them past with a determined look on his face.

Actually, all three former troopers were oozing of a mix of protective rage, determination and urgency.

‘What happened while I was asleep?’ Obi-Wan wondered in surprise as the elevator doors opened with a soft ping, eyes widening up when he noticed the shuttle ready to take off in the hanger, troopers milling around it.

He recognized some of them.

Others not.

But all of them were armed to the teeth and in armor.

When they saw the group making their way towards them, they all finished up their tasks and made their way into the shuttle where Rex pulled Obi-Wan up the ramp along. “We’re all here! Raise the ramp and go!” Rex called sternly before turning to Obi-Wan. “…Okay… now you can ask.” He said quietly.

“…What the kark is going on Rex?” Obi-Wan whispered, eyes wide, his free hand shaking.

Things had not made sense since Anakin became Vader and right now he wondered…

“The Alliance leadership are desperate,” Rex started slowly. “They… were going to force you to help, to guilt you into it… as your duty to the fallen Republic as a Jedi. We couldn’t allow that,” Rex explained quietly before glancing around the cargo hold of the shuttle they were taking out. “Vader will be after you, they know it, they were going to use you as bait and…” The captain swallowed.

Waxer spoke up. “We got our hands on an old refurbished CR-12 Corvette,” He smiled happily only for the smile to fade. “They’re not using us and they’re not using you. We’ve bleed enough for people who never cared. And if we find vode and Jedi along the way, we’ll take them with us as we take potshots at the Empire but we’re not being used by others, not anymore.” He added softly.

Blinking, Obi-Wan looked at the serious faces around him before letting out a quiet nose and stepping into Rex space, wrapping his arms around the mans neck to hide his face in a pauldron. “…Thank you.” He breathed out, feeling arms slowly come up around him in return.

“An par solus, bal solus par an Obi-Wan.” Rex murmured.

‘All for one, one for all… fitting.’ Obi-Wan tightened his hold.
